thread.title: Manchester City should have had TWO penalties during first-half against Liverpool, says Graeme Souness
thread.title_full: Manchester City should have had TWO penalties during first-half against Liverpool, says Graeme Souness

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Manchester City should have had TWO penalties during first-half against Liverpool, says Graeme Souness
text:
Sterling goes to ground on the line (Photo: Laurence Griffiths)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Manchester City appeared hard done by after being denied two penalties during their clash with Liverpool. 
Pep Guardiola's men started brightly at the Etihad in a crucial clash in the race for the top four. 
They felt they should have had a penalty during the first-half after Raheem Sterling was felled on the line by James Milner. 
Sterling looked certain to turn home Leroy Sane's cross before being sent sprawling to the ground by Milner - only for Michael Oliver to wave play on. 
Replays showed Sergio Aguero was also tripped by Ragnar Klavan in the same incident. Milner knocks Sterling over (Photo: Getty) Manchester City's Raheem Sterling tries to get on the end of a cross (Photo: PA) The City winger shows his dejection (Photo: PA) 
Speaking on Sky Sports, Graeme Souness felt City could have had two penalties. 
"Liverpool are definitely lucky. There's two penalties there," he said. 
"Klavan pulls back Aguero too before the Sterling airshot." 
Jamie Redknapp added: "James Milner's right foot just catches Sterling's foot. It's the slightest touch but it makes the difference." Clichy fouls Firmino (Photo: Getty) Milner scores from the spot (Photo: Getty) 
City's woes were compounded early in the second-half as Liverpool were awarded a penalty. 
Gael Clichy was the guilty party as he clattered into Roberto Firmino, with James Milner scoring the resulting spotkick. poll loading Will Manchester City finish in the top four? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
